intro: Ellipanthus glabrifolius, commonly known as the smooth-leaved ellipanthus, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its umbellate inflorescence. The plant has smooth, lance-shaped leaves and small white flowers that bloom in the spring. It thrives in moist, sandy soils and is often found in open woods or along stream banks. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
